results.deck: Gladius is a strategy RPG from LucasArts that puts you at the helm of a school of gladiators, and tasks you with forging the best such school in all the world.
results.name: Gladius

results.deck: Final Fight is a classic beat-em-up game developed by Capcom featuring a memorable cast of characters, including Guy, Cody, and the first and only mustachioed ex-pro-wrestler turned mayor, Mike Haggar. Released for the CPS arcade system in 1989 and then ported to the SNES and other home systems.
results.name: Final Fight

results.deck: A skating game featuring characters from popular Disney franchises.
results.name: Disney's Extreme Skate Adventure

results.deck: The 3rd installment of the ToeJam & Earl franchise finds the two rap loving aliens back on Earth, searching for the lost 12 sacred albums of funk. This game introduced a female protagonist, Latisha, and a new combat system to "funkify" those pesky earthlings.
results.name: ToeJam & Earl III: Mission to Earth

results.deck: NCAA Football 2005 is the 2004 installment of EA's NCAA Football franchise. It bears former Pittsburgh Panther and current Arizona Cardinal Larry Fitzgerald on the cover.
results.name: NCAA Football 2005

results.deck: The first rule of Fight Club is: you do not talk about Fight Club.
results.name: Fight Club

results.deck: NHL 2005 is the 14th game in the EA Sports NHL franchise.
results.name: NHL 2005

results.deck: Sega's fifth NFL game and the first to use the ESPN license. Though it is a follow-up to NFL 2K3, the game's official title does not include "2K".
results.name: ESPN NFL Football

results.deck: A golf game for Xbox and PlayStation 2.
results.name: Outlaw Golf 2

results.deck: Agent 47 is forced out of retirement and takes up contracts again in order to find the whereabouts of his captured friend.
results.name: Hitman 2: Silent Assassin

results.deck: In this terrible game in the Evil Dead franchise, Ash Williams has to once again stop the forces of evil from taking over the world. Hail to the king baby!
results.name: Evil Dead: A Fistful of Boomstick

results.deck: The sequel to Star Wars: Battlefront adds new unlockable classes, huge space battles, and the ability to play Hero characters. Battlefront II also features revamped Galactic Conquest and story modes.
results.name: Star Wars: Battlefront II

results.deck: Mat Hoffman's Pro BMX 2 is the second game in the Mat Hoffman's Pro BMX series.
results.name: Mat Hoffman's Pro BMX 2

results.deck: The sequel to Halo: Combat Evolved continues the epic story of humanity's last and best hope: the super-soldier Master Chief, as he defends Earth from a Covenant invasion and fights to prevent the activation of another Halo ring.
results.name: Halo 2

results.deck: The follow-up to Vice City takes the free-roaming violence to the state of San Andreas, an analog to early '90s California, where ruthless gangs battle for control of the streets.
results.name: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

results.deck: Getting Up is a video game created by Atari and the Collective. It revolves around the main character, a punk named Trane, as he tries to take back the city of New Radius through the medium of vandalism.
results.name: Marc Ecko's Getting Up: Contents Under Pressure

results.deck: A racing game/minigame collection based vaguely on the 2006 Disney/Pixar movie Cars, and features the full movie voice cast. The game varies greatly between platforms, and features infamously blatant rubber banding from AI players.
results.name: Cars

results.deck: Released four years after the movie that inspired it, Antz Extreme Racing features, as you would expect, the pint-sized characters from Antz participating in high-speed racing events.
results.name: Antz Extreme Racing

results.deck: NBA Live 06 is the first game in the franchise to reach next generation consoles.
results.name: NBA Live 06

results.deck: Greg Hastings' Tournament Paintball is a First Person Shooter paintball game that came out exclusively for Xbox.
results.name: Greg Hastings' Tournament Paintball

results.deck: Tony Hawk's American Wasteland is the 7th game in the Tony Hawk franchise released in 2005. Developed by Neversoft and published by Activision, it was the first Tony Hawk game to be released on the Xbox 360 and the last one for the Gamecube.
results.name: Tony Hawk's American Wasteland

results.deck: Line up colored Puyos as you attempt to recover a magic wand in this puzzle game.
results.name: Puyo Pop Fever

results.deck: Star Wars: Obi-Wan puts the player in control of Obi-wan Kenobi as a padawan. The game starts in the events leading up to Episode 1, and continues into the events in Episode 1 itself.
results.name: Star Wars: Obi-Wan

results.deck: Van Helsing is a video game adaptation of the 2004 movie of the same name.
results.name: Van Helsing

results.deck: Red Ninja is a stealth action game in the vein of Tenchu. Developed as a collaboration between Tranji Studios and film writer Shinsuke Sato.
results.name: Red Ninja: End of Honor

results.deck: A remake of the N64 platform game Conker's Bad Fur Day with improved graphics and a new online multiplayer.
results.name: Conker: Live & Reloaded

results.deck: Metal Slug 5 is the fifth game in the series.
results.name: Metal Slug 5

results.deck: EA Sports NBA game
results.name: NBA Live 07

results.deck: In this game Players can  take control of 10 playable characters and each of them have their own unique caddy. The series is noted for crude humor, particularly in regard to the characters.
results.name: Outlaw Golf

results.deck: Set in the near future, Stolen stars a cat burglar named Anya who stumbles upon a conspiracy that threatens the entire city.
results.name: Stolen

results.deck: Call of Duty 3 is a World War II-themed first-person shooter developed by Treyarch and published by Activision.
results.name: Call of Duty 3

results.deck: Take control of some of the most iconic superheroes of the Marvel Universe in this squad-based RPG. Form a well known group such as the Fantastic Four or create your own custom group of heroes to battle Dr. Doom and the Masters of Evil.
results.name: Marvel Ultimate Alliance

results.deck: A football video game brought to you by Konami, Pro Evolution Soccer 4 features thousands of licensed players.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 4

results.deck: An adaption of the novel-adapted movie of the same name. It consists of many levels, and 4 playable characters - Peter, Edmund, Susan and Lucy.
results.name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

results.deck: The third installment in the Legends of Wrestling series.
results.name: Showdown: Legends of Wrestling

results.deck: A third-person action game which intertwines the stories of The Animatrix, The Matrix: Reloaded and The Matrix: Revolutions.
results.name: Enter the Matrix

results.deck: Battle Engine Aquila is a science fiction game in which you pilot the Battle Engine for the Forseti military in their wars against the Muspell to decide who will rule what's left of the world.
results.name: Battle Engine Aquila

results.deck: The King of Fighters 2002: Challenge to the Ultimate Battle is the ninth installment of the King of Fighters series and the second "Dream Match" entry, bringing back the traditional 3-on-3 structure of pre-1999 KOF games.
results.name: The King of Fighters 2002: Challenge to Ultimate Battle

results.deck: Play as both Spider-Man and Venom in this cel-shaded open-world action-adventure game with story written by comic writer Brian Michael Bendis.
results.name: Ultimate Spider-Man

results.deck: A 3d version of the classic arcade game.
results.name: Frogger: Ancient Shadow

results.deck: Mercenaries: Playground of Destruction is a sandbox game set in a fictional North Korea which has been torn apart by a massive multinational war.
results.name: Mercenaries: Playground of Destruction

results.deck: Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks is a 3D action-adventure platformer and spin-off of the Mortal Kombat franchise, retelling the events of Mortal Kombat II as players assume the roles of the warriors Liu Kang and Kung Lao.
results.name: Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks

results.deck: When Apocalypse and his Four Horsemen threaten the safety of the world, and Magneto's position of power, the X-Men and the Brotherhood of Mutants must team-up in order to combat this threat and ultimately save the world.
results.name: X-Men: Legends II - Rise of Apocalypse

results.deck: ESPN NHL 2K5 was the fifth game in the series, and featured Martin St.Louis on the cover who was a member of the 2004 Stanley Cup Champion Tampa Bay Lightning. He was also the winner of the Hart, Lester B. Pearson, and Art Ross Trophies that season.
results.name: ESPN NHL 2K5

results.deck: House of the Dead III is a light gun game released in arcades then ported to the Xbox and PC. It was later also released on PS3 through PSN.
results.name: The House of the Dead III

results.deck: The second installment of Midway Arcade Treasures focuses on the company's biggest arcade games from the late 80s and the 90s.
results.name: Midway Arcade Treasures 2

results.deck: Doom 3: Resurrection of Evil is the first and only expansion to Doom 3, the most recent installment in id Software' s long running FPS series.
results.name: Doom 3: Resurrection of Evil

results.deck: An underground racing simulator, featuring an online mode with a pink slip system that makes racing people online more of a risk.
results.name: Juiced

results.deck: Taito Legends 2 offers 39 more of the company's games.
results.name: Taito Legends 2

results.deck: Developed by Namco, this racing simulator brings the excitement of MotoGP to the consoles.
results.name: MotoGP

results.deck: Trapped in the Mirror Universe, Captain Sulu must get his ship safely through hostile territory and find a way back home. The player is cast as a fighter pilot defending the ship during sorties.
results.name: Star Trek: Shattered Universe

results.deck: Saddle up and join Barbie on a horse-rescuing adventure.
results.name: Barbie Horse Adventure: Wild Horse Rescue

results.deck: The fourth entry in the Myst series.
results.name: Myst IV: Revelation

results.deck: A colorful platformer where you hurt yourself to hurt others.
results.name: Voodoo Vince

results.deck: A game based on the movie of the same name.
results.name: DreamWorks' Shark Tale

results.deck: Take control once more of the legends of wrestling.
results.name: Legends of Wrestling II

results.deck: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2005 further refined the character creation system and added new features such as Tiger Proofing and Legends Matches
results.name: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2005

results.deck: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System is a third-person action game developed by Swingin' Ape Studios for the GameCube, PS2, and Xbox. As Glitch you must take up arms with the Droids of Iron Star against the evil General Corrosive.
results.name: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System

results.deck: Deep in the heart of Cuba, The Ghosts battle a new enemy.
results.name: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Island Thunder

results.deck: Blood Wake is a mission based boating game that was released in 2001 as a launch title for the Xbox.
results.name: Blood Wake

results.deck:
Dr. Muto just blew up his home planet! Help him collect parts for his machine so he can rebuild his home planet.

Dr. Muto is a 3D platformer where the player takes control of Dr.Muto, a mad scientist, who uses gadgets and has the ability to morph into different animals.
results.name: Dr. Muto

results.deck: Step into the roles of the main characters, where you can use a variety of weapons, fighting techniques, weapons and stunts against enemies.
results.name: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon

results.deck: Fight Night Round 3 is a boxing game developed by EA Chicago that has been released on multiple platforms.
results.name: Fight Night Round 3

results.deck: TimeSplitters is back! Featuring more insane challenges, an updated story mode and 300% more monkey.
results.name: TimeSplitters: Future Perfect

results.deck: A comedic parody of RPG games, The Bard's Tale picks on the original Bard's Tale and Baldur's Gate considerably.  The ragamuffin Bard was voiced by veteran actor Cary Elwes.
results.name: The Bard's Tale

results.deck: The second expansion for The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind, takes place in the Nordic territory of Solstheim, featuring werewolves, a new joinable guild, and an independent storyline.
results.name: The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon

results.deck: Monsters are back to brawl again in the sequel that takes place two years after Godzilla: Destroy All Monsters Melee.
results.name: Godzilla: Save the Earth

results.deck: Starsky & Hutch is a driving and shooting game based upon the legendary television show of the 1970's.
results.name: Starsky & Hutch

results.deck: The first Commandos game to implement the famous 2D gameplay in a 3D setting. Fight the Axis in several Theaters of War using three different characters, The Beret, The Sniper and The Spy.
results.name: Commandos: Strike Force

results.deck: The third installment of the Crazy Taxi franchise
results.name: Crazy Taxi 3: High Roller

results.deck: A game based on Marvel's superhero and on the first movie of the Spider-Man franchise. It also featured many villains that did not appear in the movie.
results.name: Spider-Man: The Movie

results.deck: Described as "Gun Porn" by its creators, Black is an explosion-filled first-person shooter from Criterion, the development house responsible for the Burnout series, which focuses on destructible environments.
results.name: Black

results.deck: Harry's second year at Hogwarts is marked with whispers about his parentage, snakes, and strange spells causing students to nearly be killed.
results.name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

results.deck: Play through the events of the controversial novel in this game that was timed with the release of the movie.
results.name: The Da Vinci Code

results.deck: NASCAR 06 takes some risky steps in the series, implementing total team control, allowing you to swap cars and give out commands like hold position, block, and more!
results.name: NASCAR 06: Total Team Control

results.deck: Red Dead Revolver is a third-person shooter telling the classic tale of revenge in the 1880s American Wild West.
results.name: Red Dead Revolver

results.deck: Capcom's final entry with their collaboration with SNK, completely revamping both the "Ratio" team building system (by removing character-specific strength ratings) and the "Groove" gameplay style system (by adding new Grooves and Groove-specific fighting mechanics).
results.name: Capcom vs. SNK 2: Mark of the Millennium

results.deck: SVC Chaos pits SNK's fighters versus Capcom's on SNK's home turf: the Neo Geo.
results.name: SVC Chaos: SNK vs. Capcom

results.deck: Lara travels across the world in search of a legendary artifact. The game is considered a restart for the series after the poor reception for Angel of Darkness. It is also the first Tomb Raider game developed by Crystal Dynamics after they took over the role from Core Design.
results.name: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: Legend

results.deck: An action adventure RPG by developer BioWare which transports the player into a mystical and oriental setting based on ancient China where they must confront all sorts of dangers and find their destiny within the Jade Empire.
results.name: Jade Empire

results.deck: To Kill One You Must Become One.
results.name: Terminator 3: The Redemption

results.deck: Hummer Badlands is an obscure budget-racing game for the Xbox and Playstation 2 consoles.
results.name: Hummer: Badlands

results.deck: The third game in the Hunter: The Reckoning series.
results.name: Hunter: The Reckoning - Redeemer

results.deck: A first person shooter developed by Torus games. The plot follows a black ops soldier recruited for the Sentinel project. You must locate a man named Landau, a scientist who turns out to be a traitor with a maniacal plan.
results.name: Classified: The Sentinel Crisis

results.deck: They are the tip of the spear. They strike... swiftly, silently, and invisibly. They call themselves... "The Ghosts."
results.name: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon

results.deck: Sega GT 2002 was released as a sequel to Sega GT. Without any online play, the game focuses on developing the player with customization and driver's licenses.
results.name: Sega GT 2002

results.deck: The successor to Need for Speed: Most Wanted brought a continued storyline and new race types, but now with a lesser focus on police chases.
results.name: Need for Speed: Carbon

results.deck: Set about five years after the events of the first game, the galaxy is on the verge of falling into complete anarchy. As the last undecided Jedi, you must choose your path: either walk the path of a Jedi, or embrace the dark side and destroy the old order.
results.name: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II - The Sith Lords

results.deck: GUN is a third person action/adventure game setting you loose into 1800s America, where law is lost and crime runs rampant.
results.name: GUN
